snippet: The 2012 presidential campaign broke a barrier for Mormons across the United States, transforming the way they see themselves and the way many Americans view their church.
abstract: Mitt Romney's 2012 presidential campaign broke a barrier for Mormons across United States, who have long viewed themselves as social and political outsiders; Romney's visibility transformed the way many Mormons see themselves and the way Americans view their church.
lead_paragraph: The 2012 presidential campaign broke a barrier for Mormons across the United States, transforming the way they see themselves and the way many Americans view their church.

headline.main: For Mormons, a Cautious Step Toward Mainstream Acceptance
headline.print_headline: For Mormons, a Cautious Step Toward Mainstream Acceptance

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
